newsitem.title: PERU: Peru picks Santander for Luz del Sur share sale.
newsitem.headline: Peru picks Santander for Luz del Sur share sale.

text.p: Peru's government chose Spain's Banco Santander to handle the sale to local institutions of state-held shares in electricity distributor Luz del Sur, privatization officials said Monday.
The bank's local brokerage - Santander SAB - will direct a group of local brokerages in sales to such institutions as local pension funds, insurance companies and banks, they said.
Last week, the government chose Banco Continental to lead a group of banks handling sales to Peruvian nationals under the Citizens' Participation in Privatization scheme.

The government, which holds a 30 percent stake in Luz del Sur, also chose Banco de Credito, Interbanc and Banco Wiese to form part of the syndicate that will oversee the citizens' participation part of the sale.
The bank handling the oversees portion of the placement will be selected Sept 10, the officials added.
The Luz del Sur sale -- both in Peru and abroad -- is expected to go ahead in the final quarter of the year.

In June 1994, a consortium consisting of Chile's Chilquinta International Inc. and Canada's Ontario Hydro Inc bought a 60 percent stake in Luz del Sur, a former state-run electricity company for $212.1 million.
Another 10 percent stake is owned by company workers.
